pain_points_original.title: Inefficient High-Volume Legal Drafting
pain_points_original.description: AGS's 570 lawyers spend excessive time on manual drafting tasks like converting requests to templates and summarizing briefs. They need AI to automate 'Legal service delivery' (drafting, summarising) to improve productivity across 40 distinct areas of law.

pain_points_original.title: Discovery & Evidence Analysis Bottlenecks
pain_points_original.description: Manual review of large discovery sets and identifying inconsistencies across pleadings/witness statements is slow and error-prone. AGS requires automated ranking of documents and inconsistency detection to support high-stakes government litigation.

pain_points_original.title: Critical Security & Data Sovereignty Compliance
pain_points_original.description: As the government's central legal provider, data security is non-negotiable. Solutions MUST be 'IRAP PROTECTED' certified (NFR-SEC01) and ensure all data is stored and processed within the Australian Region (NFR-SEC04) to prevent national security risks.

pain_points_original.title: Fragmentation of Existing Legal Tech Stack
pain_points_original.description: New AI tools risk creating data silos. The solution must integrate with the existing ecosystem, specifically 'iManage Cloud' (DMS) and 'Elite 3E', to 'supplement rather than replace' current capabilities and ensure seamless workflows for 800 staff.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Autonomous 'Agentic' Workflow Execution
pain_points_original.description: Standard Generative AI is insufficient for complex workflows. AGS specifically needs 'agentic AI systems' capable of 'autonomous decision-making' and 'task orchestration' to handle multi-step executions rather than just simple chat interactions.

pain_points_original.title: AI 'Black Box' & Ethical Transparency Risk
pain_points_original.description: Government legal advice requires strict accountability. There is a strategic risk if AI outputs are not explainable. The solution must comply with NFR-REG10, ensuring all AI use is 'ethical, responsible, transparent and explainable'.

pain_points_original.title: Complex Contract & Legislative Compliance
pain_points_original.description: Manually validating documents against legislative instruments and government policies is risky. AGS needs automated tools to 'Extract obligations and dates' and 'Validate documents against legislative instruments' to ensure strict regulatory compliance.

pain_points_original.title: Inefficient Internal Knowledge Retrieval
pain_points_original.description: Lawyers struggle to surface relevant insights from vast internal data. AGS needs 'Smart search' with 'named entity recognition' and 'auto-indexing' to improve findability across their full-text corpus, ensuring valuable precedents are not missed.

pain_points_original.title: Manual Resource & Capacity Planning
pain_points_original.description: Managing rosters and workload for 800 staff is inefficient. AGS seeks tools to analyze 'staffing and time/activity patterns' to automate roster scheduling and optimize 'Capacity work allocation' against lawyer expertise.

pain_points_original.title: Labor-Intensive Tender Response Processes
pain_points_original.description: Preparing bids for government work is time-consuming. AGS seeks to automate the analysis of tender requirements and the drafting of 'capability statements' based on past project documents to improve business development efficiency.
